intro: Melissitus late-alatus, commonly known as the late-winged melissitus, is a species of moth belonging to the family Geometridae. It is characterized by its distinctive wing patterns, which feature a series of intricate, wavy lines that aid in camouflage. The adult moth is typically active during the late summer months, which aligns with its common name. Its larvae feed on a variety of shrubs and small trees, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its habitat. The plant's botanical significance lies in its role as a host for the moth's life cycle and its contribution to local biodiversity.
